info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 01 at 3:10AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Maui, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, and the Big Island. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A kona low west of the islands will keep a moist and unstable air mass over the islands today. This will result in the potential for flash flooding and thunderstorms.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
